singlePlayerMode

Class Achievements

  • java.lang.Object
    • singlePlayerMode.Achievements

  • public class Achievements
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    1397/03/09 Achievements class is a class which has the duty of saving all the achievements of the Player.It's contained by 5 private attributes power,correctAnswers,allQuests,allLetters and correctLetters which need to be shown to the user at the end of the game by our gui.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Achievements()
      Achievements constructor constructs a class of Achievements with all the values set to zero or null but power attribute which has the initial value of 100.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAllLetters()
      getAllLetters is a getter method which returns the number of all letters given to user.
      int getAllQuests()
      getAllQuests is a getter method which returns number of series of characters given the Player to type.
      int getCorrectAnswers()
      getCorrectAnswers is a getter method which return the an integer representing the number of the correct answers that the Player has earned during the game.
      int getCorrectLetters()
      getCorrectLetters is a getter method which returns the number of letters that are entered correctly by the user.
      int getPower()
      getPower is a getter method which gets the power of the player (which is constantly being changed as an attribute of the class Player).
      void setAllLetters(int allLetters)
      setAllLetters sets the attribute representing all the letters given to the Player by the given time by Stopwatch.
      void setAllQuests(int allQuests)
      setAllQuests is a setter which sets the value of allQuests.
      void setCorrectAnswers(int correctAnswers)
      setCorrectAnswer is a setter method used for setting a value in the class Achievements which is representing number of the correct Tasks that the player has achieved during a one -time game.
      void setCorrectLetters(int correctLetters)
      setCorrectLetters is a setter which sets the number of the letters entered correctly by the Player
      void setPower(int power)
      setPower is a setter method which sets the value of the power which is shown in the progress bar in MainFrame.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getPower

        public int getPower()
        getPower is a getter method which gets the power of the player (which is constantly being changed as an attribute of the class Player).
        Returns:
        the power which is show in progress bar in MainFrame

      • setPower

        public void setPower(int power)
        setPower is a setter method which sets the value of the power which is shown in the progress bar in MainFrame.
        Parameters:
        power - the power that any player has which represents the the time/energy that he/she has got left to play.

      • getCorrectAnswers

        Returns:

        correctAnswers -
